message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE 

The paper presents a neurorobotics cognitive model for understanding and generalisation of noun-verb combinations through grounding process and learning approach inspired by developmental language acquisition in infants. This involves object manipulation tasks with a humanoid robot platform and the use of Multiple Time-scale Recurrent Neural Networks (MTRNN). Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the Robotics (cs.RO) sub-category, as it involves a robotic agent implementing the model. It also involves natural language processing and machine learning, which suggests that it could belong to the Computational Linguistics (cs.CL), Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI), and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Finally, the use of neural networks and learning approach suggests that it could also belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category.
